title: New Braunfels and Comal County to Share Emergency Operations Space
summary: New Braunfels will partner with Comal County to share emergency operations facilities, improving coordination and resource efficiency for disaster response and emergency management.

title: Comal County Appoints Interim Justice of Peace for Precinct 3
summary: Comal County commissioners appointed Mark Long as interim judge to fulfill the unexpired term for justice of the peace in Precinct 3, filling a judicial vacancy.

title: City Council Approves TIRZ Board Appointments
summary: New Braunfels City Council approved appointments to River Mill, Zipp Park, and West End TIRZ boards. Terms expire November 2027, except for Kyle Coker, Skylar Duran, and Patrick Wiggins whose terms expire in 2026.

title: New Braunfels Approves .2M Fire Training Facility Investment
summary: The city has allocated .2 million for a new fire training facility to boost firefighter readiness and response capabilities as the community continues to grow.

title: New Braunfels ISD Rejects State Prayer Time Requirement
summary: The NBISD Board of Trustees unanimously voted to decline adopting Senate Bill 11's required daily prayer and religious reading period, citing parental autonomy and existing religious expression rights.

title: New Braunfels City Council Approves Annexation of 200 Acres
summary: City Council voted 5-2 to annex approximately 200 acres along FM 306 for future mixed-use development. Council members Edwards and Spradley voted against, citing infrastructure concerns.

title: Comal County Commissioners Discuss Budget for Road Repairs
summary: Commissioners Court reviewed a proposed $12M allocation for county road repairs, prioritizing routes in precincts 1 and 3 that have seen the most growth-related wear.

title: School Board Reviews Policy on Parental Notification
summary: The Comal ISD Board of Trustees discussed updates to its parental notification policies, aiming to increase transparency around curriculum changes and library material reviews.
